intro: Styphelia pleiosperma, commonly known as the coastal heath, is a flowering plant native to the western coast of Australia. It is a low-growing shrub that typically reaches a height of about 10–20 centimeters. The plant produces small, white or pinkish flowers during the spring and summer months. Its leaves are narrow and leathery, adapted to the dry, sandy soils of its coastal habitat. Styphelia pleiosperma is often found in heathlands and is characteristic of the Southwest Australian biodiversity hotspot.
